'''Ildibad''' (Sometimes rendered '''Hildebad''' or '''Heldebadus''') (died 541) was a king of the [[Ostrogoth]]s in [[Italy]], being chosen to replace [[Witiges]], who had been engaged in various intregues with [[Belisarius]], and had left [[Ravenna]]. He moved his capital to [[Pavia]] in 540<ref>[[Herwig Wolfram]], ''History of the Goths'' (University of California Press, 1990).</ref>, conquered [[Treviso]], installing his nephew [[Totila]] as commander, and soon controlled [[Venetia (region)|Venetia]] and [[Liguria]].<ref>Wolfram (1990)</ref>
Ildibald reigned for only about a year before being killed by a [[Gepid]] at a palace banquet. After a brief interlude under [[Eraric]], he was succeeded by his nephew Totila.
Ildibad was a nephew of [[Theudis]], one of the Visigothic kings in [[Spain]]. This relationship led Peter Heather to suggest that both belonged to a powerful, non-royal clan.<ref>Peter Heather, ''The Goths'' (Oxford: Blackwell, 1996), p. 242</ref>
